recipes.name: Chettinad Chicken
recipes.description: Fiery and aromatic chicken curry from Tamil Nadu's Chettinad region. Known for its complex spice blend.

steps.instruction: Dry roast black pepper, fennel, red chilies, cinnamon, and star anise until fragrant. Cool and grind to powder.
Grind coconut to a fine paste.
Marinate chicken with turmeric, half the spice powder, and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a heavy pan. Add curry leaves and sliced onions. Fry until deep golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add marinated chicken and cook on high heat for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add remaining spice powder and coconut paste. Cover and cook until chicken is done.

tips: Freshly ground spices make all the difference
Kalpasi (stone flower) adds authentic flavor if available
The gravy should be thick and coat the chicken

recipes.name: Kerala Fish Curry
recipes.description: Tangy and spicy fish curry with raw mango or kudampuli. A Kerala household staple.

steps.instruction: Soak kudampuli in warm water. Clean fish and apply salt and turmeric.
In a clay pot, add sliced shallots, garlic, green chilies, and ginger at the bottom.
Mix chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric with water to make a paste. Pour over vegetables.
Add soaked kudampuli with its water, salt, and 1 cup water. Bring to boil.
Gently place fish pieces in the curry. Cook on low-medium heat for 10-12 minutes.
Add fenugreek, curry leaves, and pour coconut oil on top. Swirl the pot gently.

tips: Use a clay pot for authentic flavor
Don't stir, just swirl the pot gently
Let it rest for an hour for best taste

recipes.name: Appam
recipes.description: Lacy, bowl-shaped rice pancakes with soft center. Signature Kerala breakfast.

steps.instruction: Soak raw rice for 4-6 hours.
Grind soaked rice with cooked rice to a smooth batter. Add water if needed.
Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Add to batter. Ferment for 8 hours or overnight.
Before making appam, add coconut milk and salt. Mix well. Batter should be thin and pourable.
Heat appam pan. Pour a ladle of batter and swirl the pan to spread batter on the edges.
Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes until edges are crispy and center is soft.

tips: The pan must be well-seasoned
Fermentation is key for soft center
Swirl quickly for lacy edges

recipes.name: Gongura Chicken
recipes.description: Tangy chicken curry with sorrel leaves (gongura). Signature dish of Andhra Pradesh.

steps.instruction: Wash gongura leaves thoroughly. Chop roughly.
Heat oil, add mustard and cumin seeds. Add dried red chilies and curry leaves.
Add sliced onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions are golden.
Add crushed garlic and turmeric. Sauté for a minute.
Add chicken pieces and cook on high heat for 5 minutes.
Add gongura leaves and salt. Cover and cook until chicken is done. The leaves will wilt and create a tangy gravy.

tips: Use red gongura for more tanginess
Don't add water - the leaves release moisture
Tastes better the next day

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Dum Biryani
recipes.description: Aromatic layered rice and meat dish slow-cooked to perfection. Pride of Telangana cuisine.

steps.instruction: Marinate meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, mint, coriander, green chilies, and salt. Rest for 2 hours.
Soak saffron in warm milk. Soak rice for 30 minutes.
Slice onions and fry in oil until deep golden brown (birista). Reserve for layering.
In a heavy-bottomed pot, add marinated meat. Top with half the fried onions.
Par-boil rice with whole spices until 70% done. Drain and layer over meat.
Top with remaining onions, saffron milk, and ghee. Seal pot with dough.
Cook on high heat for 5 minutes, then on very low heat for 45 minutes (dum).

tips: Marination time is crucial
Don't open the pot during dum
Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving

recipes.name: Ven Pongal
recipes.description: Comforting rice and moong dal porridge tempered with black pepper and cumin. Classic Tamil breakfast.

steps.instruction: Dry roast moong dal until fragrant. Wash rice and dal together.
Pressure cook rice and dal with 4 cups water and salt until mushy (3-4 whistles).
Mash the cooked mixture well while still hot.
Heat ghee in a pan. Add cashews and fry until golden. Remove and set aside.
In the same ghee, add crushed pepper, cumin, ginger, curry leaves, and asafoetida.
Pour the tempering over the pongal. Add cashews and mix well.

tips: Use generous ghee for authentic taste
The pongal should be soft and creamy
Best served hot

recipes.name: Puttu
recipes.description: Steamed rice cylinders with coconut. Iconic Kerala breakfast.

steps.instruction: Add salt to puttu flour. Sprinkle water gradually and mix with fingers.
The flour should be crumbly, not sticky. If squeezed, it should hold but crumble when touched.
Fill puttu maker with alternating layers of coconut and flour.
Steam for 5-7 minutes until steam comes out of the holes.
Push out the puttu gently and serve hot.

tips: The flour moisture is critical - not too wet or dry
Layer coconut and flour evenly
Best served immediately

recipes.name: Medu Vada
recipes.description: Crispy urad dal donuts, golden on outside and soft inside. South Indian breakfast favorite.

steps.instruction: Soak urad dal for 3-4 hours. Drain well.
Grind to a thick, fluffy batter using minimal water. Beat well to incorporate air.
Add crushed pepper, cumin, chopped chilies, ginger, curry leaves, asafoetida, and salt.
Heat oil for deep frying. Wet your hands, take a portion of batter.
Shape into a ball, flatten, and make a hole in the center. Slide into hot oil.
Fry on medium heat, flipping once, until golden brown on both sides.

tips: The batter must be thick and airy
Add a few grains of rice while grinding for crispiness
Fry on medium heat for even cooking

recipes.name: Avial
recipes.description: Mixed vegetables in coconut-yogurt sauce. Kerala Onam sadya essential.

steps.instruction: Cut vegetables into long strips. Use drumstick, ash gourd, yam, raw banana, beans, carrot.
Cook vegetables with turmeric and salt until tender but not mushy.
Coarsely grind coconut with green chilies and cumin.
Add ground coconut to vegetables. Mix gently.
Add whisked yogurt. Cook on low heat for 2-3 minutes. Don't boil.
Add curry leaves and drizzle coconut oil on top.

tips: Don't boil after adding yogurt
Cut vegetables into uniform strips
Raw coconut oil gives authentic flavor

recipes.name: Masala Dosa
recipes.description: Crispy fermented rice crepe filled with spiced potato filling. South India's most famous breakfast.

steps.instruction: Boil potatoes until soft. Peel and mash coarsely.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, dals, and curry leaves. When they splutter, add sliced onions.
Add green chilies and sauté onions until translucent. Add turmeric.
Add mashed potatoes and salt. Mix well and cook for 3 minutes. Keep warm.
Heat dosa pan. Pour batter and spread in circular motion from center outwards.
Drizzle oil around edges. Cook until golden and crispy. Place filling and fold.

tips: Ferment batter for at least 8 hours
The pan should be hot for crispy dosa
Use cast iron pan for best results

recipes.name: Sambar
recipes.description: Tangy lentil stew with vegetables and aromatic sambar powder. Heart of South Indian meals.

steps.instruction: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until soft and mushy.
Soak tamarind in warm water and extract juice.
Cook vegetables separately until tender.
Mix dal, vegetables, tamarind water, and sambar powder. Boil for 10 minutes.
Heat oil, add mustard, fenugreek, red chilies, curry leaves, and asafoetida.
Pour tempering into sambar. Simmer for 5 minutes.

tips: Use homemade sambar powder for best taste
Don't overcook vegetables
Let it rest for flavors to develop

recipes.name: Rasam
recipes.description: Spicy, tangy tomato and tamarind broth. Soul-warming South Indian soup.

steps.instruction: Soak tamarind in warm water and extract juice.
Crush tomatoes coarsely. Crush garlic, pepper, and cumin together.
Boil tamarind water with tomatoes, rasam powder, crushed mixture, and salt.
When it starts to froth, remove from heat immediately.
Heat ghee, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. Pour over rasam.
Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot.

tips: Don't boil after frothing or it becomes bitter
Fresh crushed pepper is key
Great for cold and flu

recipes.name: Idli
recipes.description: Soft, fluffy steamed rice cakes. Most popular South Indian breakfast.

steps.instruction: Soak rice and dal separately for 4-6 hours. Soak fenugreek with dal.
Grind dal first to a fluffy batter. Then grind rice to a slightly grainy batter.
Mix both batters with salt. Ferment for 8-12 hours until doubled.
Grease idli plates. Pour batter into each mold.
Steam for 10-12 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let cool for a minute before unmolding.

tips: Fermentation is crucial for soft idlis
Don't over-grind - slight graininess is good
Store batter in fridge for up to 3 days

recipes.name: Kerala Parotta
recipes.description: Flaky, layered flatbread with soft interior. Kerala's answer to paratha.

steps.instruction: Mix flour, salt, and sugar. Add egg, milk, and 2 tbsp oil. Knead to soft dough.
Rest dough covered for 2 hours.
Divide into balls. Roll each into thin sheet. Apply oil and fold like a fan.
Roll the strip into a coil. Flatten gently into a disc. Rest for 15 minutes.
Roll out to medium thickness. Cook on hot tawa with oil.
Clap between palms to separate layers while still hot.

tips: Resting time is crucial for layers
Use generous oil while layering
Clap immediately while hot

recipes.name: Kerala Egg Roast
recipes.description: Boiled eggs in spicy onion-tomato masala. Popular Kerala breakfast with appam.

steps.instruction: Boil eggs, peel, and make slits on the surface.
Heat coconut oil. Add sliced onions and curry leaves. Fry until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chili powder and turmeric. Sauté on low heat to avoid burning.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down.
Add eggs and coat with masala. Sprinkle garam masala. Cook for 3 minutes.

tips: Make slits for masala to penetrate eggs
Use coconut oil for authentic taste
Deep brown onions are key to flavor

recipes.name: Curd Rice
recipes.description: Cooling yogurt rice dish. Perfect ending to a South Indian meal.

steps.instruction: Mash cooked rice slightly while still warm.
Add milk and mix. Let it cool down.
Add whisked yogurt and salt. Mix well.
Heat oil. Add mustard, urad dal, curry leaves, green chilies, ginger, and asafoetida.
Pour tempering over rice. Mix gently.
Refrigerate if not serving immediately. Add more yogurt if it dries out.

tips: Use slightly overcooked rice
Add pomegranate or grapes for variation
Best served chilled

recipes.name: Lemon Rice
recipes.description: Tangy, zesty rice dish with peanuts. Popular lunch box option.

steps.instruction: Spread cooked rice on a plate and let it cool. Drizzle 1 tbsp oil to prevent sticking.
Heat oil. Add peanuts and fry until golden. Remove and set aside.
In same oil, add mustard, dals, red chilies, green chilies, curry leaves.
Add turmeric and asafoetida. Turn off heat.
Add rice, salt, and lemon juice. Mix gently without breaking grains.
Add peanuts and mix. Garnish with coriander if desired.

tips: Add lemon juice after turning off heat
Use day-old rice for best results
Adjust sourness to taste

recipes.name: Pesarattu
recipes.description: Crispy green moong dal crepe. Protein-rich Andhra Pradesh special.

steps.instruction: Soak moong dal and rice together for 4-6 hours.
Grind with green chilies, ginger, and cumin to a smooth batter.
Add salt and water to get pouring consistency. No fermentation needed.
Heat dosa pan. Pour batter and spread thin.
Sprinkle chopped onions if desired. Drizzle oil around edges.
Cook until crispy and golden. Fold and serve hot.

tips: No fermentation required - can be made instantly after grinding
Sprinkle onions for extra flavor
Serve with ginger chutney

recipes.name: Chicken 65
recipes.description: Spicy, deep-fried chicken with distinctive red color. Iconic Andhra appetizer.

steps.instruction: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Wash and pat dry.
Marinate with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, salt, and lemon juice for 30 minutes.
Add corn flour, rice flour, and beaten egg. Mix well.
Heat oil for deep frying. Fry chicken in batches until golden and crispy.
In a wok with 2 tbsp oil, fry curry leaves and slit green chilies.
Add fried chicken and toss well. Serve hot.

tips: Double frying makes it extra crispy
Kashmiri chili for color without excessive heat
Add a splash of yogurt while tossing for creaminess

recipes.name: Puliyogare
recipes.description: Tangy tamarind rice with aromatic spice paste. Temple prasadam favorite.

steps.instruction: Dry roast chana dal, coriander, red chilies, fenugreek, and sesame. Grind to powder.
Soak tamarind and extract thick juice.
Heat oil. Add mustard, peanuts, and curry leaves.
Add tamarind juice, turmeric, jaggery, salt. Cook until thick.
Add ground powder. Mix well and cook for 3 minutes.
Add cooled rice and mix gently. Adjust seasoning.

tips: The paste can be stored for weeks
Let rice cool before mixing
Tastes better after a few hours

recipes.name: Kootu
recipes.description: Vegetables and lentils in coconut gravy. Nutritious Tamil Nadu staple.

steps.instruction: Pressure cook chana dal until soft but not mushy.
Cook vegetables with turmeric and salt until tender.
Grind coconut, cumin, and pepper to a coarse paste.
Combine dal, vegetables, and coconut paste. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Heat oil. Add mustard, curry leaves, and red chilies.
Pour tempering over kootu. Mix well.

tips: Use raw banana, yam, or ash gourd for traditional kootu
Don't make coconut paste too fine
Should be thick, not watery

recipes.name: Beans Poriyal
recipes.description: Stir-fried green beans with coconut. Classic Tamil dry vegetable dish.

steps.instruction: Wash and finely chop beans.
Heat oil. Add mustard, dals, red chilies, and curry leaves.
Add beans, turmeric, and salt. Mix well.
Sprinkle water, cover, and cook on low heat until beans are tender.
Remove lid and cook until dry.
Add grated coconut and toss well.

tips: Don't overcook - beans should have slight crunch
Add coconut only at the end
Works great with carrot, cabbage, or beetroot too

recipes.name: Malabar Chicken Biryani
recipes.description: Fragrant biryani from Kerala's Malabar region with short-grain rice and whole spices.

steps.instruction: Marinate chicken with yogurt, biryani masala, and salt for 1 hour.
Slice onions thin. Fry until crispy and golden. Set aside half for layering.
In the same oil, add whole spices, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies.
Add tomatoes, mint, coriander, and cook until soft.
Add marinated chicken. Cook until 80% done.
Soak rice for 20 min. Par-boil with whole spices until 70% done.
Layer rice over chicken. Top with fried onions, ghee, and saffron milk.
Seal and cook on dum for 25-30 minutes.

tips: Kaima rice (short grain) is traditional for Malabar biryani
The biryani should be slightly wet
Serve with raita and pickle

recipes.name: Prawn Ghee Roast
recipes.description: Succulent prawns in rich ghee-based spicy masala. Mangalorean coastal specialty.

steps.instruction: Clean prawns and devein. Marinate with turmeric and salt.
Soak chilies and tamarind in warm water. Grind with coriander, cumin, pepper, and garlic.
Heat ghee. Fry sliced onions until golden brown.
Add ground masala paste. Sauté until oil separates.
Add prawns and curry leaves. Cook until prawns are done.
Finish with extra ghee drizzle. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Tamil Fish Fry
recipes.description: Crispy pan-fried fish with aromatic Tamil spice coating. Street food favorite.

steps.instruction: Clean fish and make slits. Pat dry.
Mix all spices, rice flour, lemon juice, and salt to make paste.
Apply paste generously on fish, inside slits too. Marinate 30 min.
Heat oil in a pan. Shallow fry fish on medium heat.
Flip carefully and fry other side until crispy and cooked through.

recipes.name: Mutton Pepper Fry
recipes.description: Tender mutton pieces tossed with crushed pepper and curry leaves. Tamil Nadu specialty.

steps.instruction: Pressure cook mutton with turmeric and salt until tender.
Coarsely crush peppercorns and fennel seeds.
Heat oil. Fry onions until deep golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and curry leaves. Sauté.
Add cooked mutton and crushed pepper-fennel. Toss on high heat.
Fry until dry and well coated with spices.

recipes.name: Nadan Kozhi Curry
recipes.description: Traditional Kerala chicken curry with coconut and roasted spices. Home-style comfort food.

steps.instruction: Marinate chicken with turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 min.
Grind coconut to a fine paste. Set aside.
Heat coconut oil. Fry sliced onions until golden brown.
Add ginger, garlic, green chilies. Sauté for 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy. Add coriander powder.
Add chicken and cook on high heat for 10 minutes.
Add coconut paste and water. Cover and cook until chicken is done.
Finish with curry leaves and garam masala.

recipes.name: Andhra Chicken Curry
recipes.description: Fiery red chicken curry from Andhra Pradesh. Bold flavors with guntur chilies.

steps.instruction: Heat oil. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add sliced onions. Fry until deep golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until raw smell goes.
Add all spice powders and sauté on low heat.
Add tomatoes and cook until oil separates.
Add chicken pieces. Coat well with masala.
Add water if needed. Cover and cook until chicken is done.

recipes.name: Kerala Prawn Curry
recipes.description: Creamy coconut prawn curry with raw mango. Kerala coastal delicacy.

steps.instruction: Clean prawns and marinate with turmeric and salt.
In a clay pot, layer shallots, green chilies, and raw mango.
Add chili powder, turmeric, salt and thin coconut milk.
Bring to boil. Add prawns and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add thick coconut milk. Simmer for 3 minutes.
Add curry leaves and drizzle coconut oil.

recipes.name: Chettinad Fish Fry
recipes.description: Spicy pan-fried fish with Chettinad masala. Aromatic and crispy.

steps.instruction: Dry roast pepper, fennel, and red chilies. Grind with garlic to paste.
Apply paste and turmeric on fish. Marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan. Add curry leaves.
Pan fry fish on medium heat until golden on both sides.
Drain and serve hot with lemon wedge.

recipes.name: Mutton Chukka
recipes.description: Dry roasted mutton with aromatic spices. Tamil Nadu's beloved dry curry.

steps.instruction: Pressure cook mutton with turmeric and salt until tender.
Heat oil. Fry onions until browned.
Add ginger-garlic paste and curry leaves. Sauté.
Add tomatoes and all spice powders. Cook until dry.
Add cooked mutton. Roast on high heat until dry and coated.
Continue roasting until mutton is well browned.

recipes.name: Chicken Sukka
recipes.description: Dry roasted chicken with coconut. Mangalorean specialty with bold flavors.

steps.instruction: Roast coconut until golden. Roast spices separately.
Grind roasted coconut, spices, and tamarind to coarse paste.
Marinate chicken with turmeric and salt.
Heat oil. Fry onions until golden. Add curry leaves.
Add chicken and cook on high heat for 10 minutes.
Add ground masala. Cook until dry and chicken is well coated.

recipes.name: Telangana Mutton Curry
recipes.description: Rich mutton curry with distinctive Telangana flavors. Slow-cooked perfection.

steps.instruction: Dry roast poppy and sesame seeds. Grind to paste.
Heat oil. Fry sliced onions until deep brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste. Sauté for 2 minutes.
Add spice powders. Sauté on low heat.
Add tomatoes and cook until oil separates.
Add mutton and sear on high heat.
Add water and pressure cook until tender.
Open lid, add seed paste and garam masala. Simmer.

recipes.name: Kerala Beef Fry
recipes.description: Crispy dry-fried beef with coconut chips and curry leaves. Kerala's iconic dish.

steps.instruction: Cut beef into small pieces. Pressure cook with turmeric, salt, and crushed pepper.
Heat coconut oil. Fry coconut slices until golden. Remove.
Fry curry leaves until crispy. Remove.
In same oil, fry sliced onions until deep brown.
Add ginger, garlic, green chilies. Sauté well.
Add chili powder and cooked beef. Fry on high heat until very dry.
Add garam masala, fried coconut, and curry leaves. Toss.

recipes.name: Mangalorean Fish Curry
recipes.description: Tangy coconut fish curry from coastal Karnataka. Distinctive red color from byadgi chilies.

steps.instruction: Roast coconut lightly. Roast spices and chilies separately.
Grind roasted ingredients with tamarind and garlic to smooth paste.
Apply turmeric and salt on fish pieces.
Boil ground masala with water. Add curry leaves.
Gently add fish. Cook without stirring for 10 minutes.
Drizzle coconut oil on top. Let it rest before serving.
